definition: to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: My father was out of work. At that time, I went to Xuzhou City from Beijing, planning to go back home with Father to deal with the affairs about my grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 我從北京到徐州，打算跟着父親奔喪回家。

sentences.english: Did I come back to grieve for my father or to congratulate my step-mother?
sentences.chinese: 我回來，是爲父王奔喪，還是爲母后賀喜？

definition: taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
on leaving/on the point of departure
